name: Millenium Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was great! The view from the window was breath-taking, the room was spacious and so clean when we arrived. The staff was so friendly and so helpful giving us tips and directions as it was our first time in NYC.
reviews.title: Amazing View

reviews.text: My second stay was a complete disappointment- How can you ruin a world class location/view across from the NYC Freedom tower? Not easily but Hilton found a way-- NO service level at all--The rooms were tired-- Had to change rooms--that process took too long--However, the views were spectacular--freedom tower and brookyln bridge from 46th floor--But the view did not compensate for the lack of service
reviews.title: great location terrible serive
Wonder what I need to do to get a proper response from Millenium Hilton?
reviews.text: A few weeks ago, after many months of researching hotels in NYC we decided upon the Millenium Hilton as our accommodation of choice for our upcoming vacation in November and to try it out for future business trips.
We decided to join the HHonors program, thinking that we would be able to use Hilton Hotels worldwide as our preferred hotels for business trips.
reviews.title: Very unimpressed

reviews.text: However we noticed that the prices on the Hilton website were substantially more expensive than travel websites. Plus we wondered if we could still get our Hilton points if we used a travel website to make the booking.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: This is my least favorite Hilton property every. I have stayed here twice in the past 4 or 5 years, and the location *is* very convenient, depending on where you are going in the city. (Though, even if you are going to midtown or uptown, the subways are right there, outside the hotel.)
reviews.title: Good location, tons of noise - they did what they could with the space

reviews.text: But, the hotel itself is not particularly fantastic. As others have noted, the lobby is very small, which allows for no privacy when checking in, especially if you are part of a conference group (as I was this past visit). In fact, the whole property is long and narrow, which makes the floors seem like floors in a dormitory. But, you know, they did what they could with the space they had - can't fault them for that.
reviews.title: Great location. Average hotel. Expensive wi-fi!

reviews.text: You can fault them, though, for thin walls and windows. There is a lot of traffic noise (particularly because of the construction at the 9/11 site -- though this is much improved over my last stay, where construction was literally 24 hours). There is also a lot of noise between rooms -- hearing voices, burps, etc. And, in both rooms I have stayed in here, the toilet tank ran incessantly, and I had to keep the door to the bathroom closed. In fact, the plumbing in general was loud.
reviews.title: New York Experience

reviews.text: So, not my favorite. But I found the staff to be lovely and responsive overall. I was there for a conference, and, also found the meals to be above average (though not memorable).
reviews.title: Not one bad thing to say

reviews.text: Tip: Many cab drivers are unfamiliar with the Financial DIstrict. I probably had 3 cabbies ask to drop me off about 5 blocks from the hotel because -- due to the streets going off grid, their unfamiliarity with the area, and all the construction -- they didn't know how to get their car to the actual hotel. Be prepared for this, especially if mobility is an issue.
reviews.title: Nice visit

reviews.text: We have just returned from a 6 night stay at the millenium Hilton,we found the hotel to be very coveniently situated in lower Manhattan out of the main tourist throng but with access to Times Suare in under 7 minutes on the subway.We found the hotel facilities to be superb,swimming pool and sauna at no extra charge,fitness room (if req!) and both the lobby bar and the 3rd floor bar attached to the restaurant gave great service in pleasant surroundings.Our room was on the 33rd floor with great views over lower Manhattan and the Hudson River it was clean,modern very spacious and well maintained by the maid.All in all we had a fantastic stay and the hotel is highly recommended
reviews.title: Highly recommended !
BEST TRIP TO DATE!!!!!
reviews.text: Me and my boyfriend have just returned from a six day break at the Millenium Hilton. It is our best trip to date. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel. Good location for subway links, loved the 42" plasma TV, and the views of the city. Never used the Hotels Restaurant, as there was plenty of good all night delis and starbucks near by. DEF will return!!!!! 10 out of 10!!!!

reviews.title: Would stay again
reviews.text: We stayed at this property Feb 18-20th in rm 3410. It was my husband's birthday so we requested a high floor with a nice view. The room overlooked ground zero and was a decent size for NY standards. There wasn't anything special about the decor, but it was nice and the room was very clean upon arrival. Nice plasma tv, heat controllable by thermostat (no problems) and the bathroom was very clean with Neutrogena amenities. The bell staff was very good and friendly as was the concierge. My only complaint is that on day two, the maid did a very poor job of cleaning the room. I think she just made up the bed. (BTW, the bed was quite comfy with nice linens). I wrote to the Hilton upon my return and they have been extremely responsive regarding my complaint. Also, the turn down service was just that, "turn down of the bed only". We have stayed at many hotels in NYC and their turn down service also included a "tidy-up" of the bath and room. Other than that I enjoyed the hotel and loved the fact that Century 21 is across the street. I would stay here again but would choose someplace else for a special occasion like a birthday or anniversary.

reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel with Great Views
reviews.text: I took my husband to New York for Valentine's weekend and stayed here for 2 nights. Could not believe how quickly the lifts took you to each floor- we were on the 37th floor and our ears popped the lifts were so fast. The room had a fantastic view over Ground Zero. An added advantage was being next door to Century 21 - a must for bargain hunters.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: Quite a few nice restaurnants close by. Can walk to ferry for Statue of Liberty and also walk to China Town and Little Italy.

I stay at this hotel constantly since it incredibley convenient to the Finacial District and I find it a terrific busness hotel. All of my needs are met in terms of health club, pool, bar and restaurant plus the rooms are well maintained, very well equipped and imaculatley clean. The best feature of this hotel is the staff who are universally friendly, helpful and willing to assit with any request.
reviews.title: Millenium Hilton-a great business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An overlooked apsect of this hotel is its proximity to some fine dinning just a few blocks walk or a short cab ride north to Tribecca, etc.; we found the doorman and concierge a wealth of good referrals!
reviews.title: Amazing View!

likes.disliked: — the dirty part on top of the window

reviews.title: Ground Zero vista
reviews.text: My husband and I went to the Hilton for our anniversary, and when we checked in we told them. We booked the romance package, including champagne, strawberries and chocolate and full american breakfasts.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on the room and we saw that they upgraded us to the corner, meaning a "mini-suite", with a small living room plus an amazing bedroom with view on the 23th floor of the hotel looking at the ground zero.
reviews.title: Less than desirable

likes.disliked: — Not impressed with anything concerning the Hilton

reviews.text: We were really happy of the room.
reviews.title: Best Stay!

reviews.text: Stayed here between 14 - 17 September 2007. The hotel's has a new modern feel to it but lacks character. The 42" plasma is a nice touch but they are cheap 42" plasmas and therefore the quality of the picture is not great, however, that's really not that important unless you are considering spending the whole time wathcing TV in your bedroom. The hotel staff were average/above average i.e. some good, some crap! The Church & Dey restaurant is like a morgue, basically nobody seems to go in there for some reason, maybe it was the bread (like chewing a brick). The waiters/esses were looking for something to do (have never seen to waiters fight over who to take the empty plates to the kitchen before!). Small, crowded reception area, extremely noisy outside with the WTC construction. +'s were next to Century 21 and opposite train station. If you are looking for a suite stay in Embassy Suites down in Battery Park, similar price + free buffet breakfast
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed on northwest corner suite. Noise was never ending from WTC site.
reviews.title: Views of WTC pit and 24/7 Noise from Site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel and wonderful location. We booked online through Expedia and got a fantastic deal for a Jr. Suite. The room was large and very clean. The staff in general were very nice, giving the bar staff the biggest kudoos. Our only complaint is that when my husband miss placed his key, the front desk would not give him another one, because the room was not booked in his name. However, at check in they asked for the name of anyone else staying in the room. If I hadn't been there (in the shower at the time) he would hvae been loked out until I returned. When I went downstairs to ask why his name hadn't been added to the guest list, I recieved a blank stare and asked if I wanted to get another key. Other than that we had a great stay and since Centry 21 is right next door we will be returning sooner than my husband thinks! LOL
reviews.title: Great stay

likes.liked: — the room, the view, Centry 21 right next door

reviews.text: I have just returned from a five day break at the Millenium Hilton NYC and can't wait to return. If you are looking for a fantastic hotel with breathtaking views and great comfort look no further.
reviews.title: The Tops!
Loved It
reviews.text: We had a junior suite on the fifteenth floor which was ample space for a family of four. It consisted of two rooms connected by a small hallway and a bathroom.

Having read the reviews on this hotel, I was worried that my expectations would be too high but luckily I wasn't disappointed! My husband and I spent 3 nights here from 3rd to 6th March 2005 and found the hotel to be superb in every way. We were originally given a room on the 15th floor but after we spoke to the reception staff about getting a room on a higher floor, we were given one on the 52nd floor! The views day and night were amazing especially as the weather was very clear and fine.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: The location is great. After my last trip to New York, when I stayed in a grubby hotel in Midtown, I was keen to experience a different area. So many interesting places are walking distance away, such as Chinatown, Little Italy, South Street Seaport and Greenwich Village. Even when we occasionally ventured uptown, the subway station was right outside.
reviews.title: Dumbstruck
Loved it
reviews.text: The room was immaculate and very clean although it did get quite warm at night. One evening I opened the little window and couldn't shut it again but a member of staff arrived in minutes to assist us! In all, the staff were very helpful, especially the bellboys who always had a smile on their faces! I would DEFINITELY stay here again, particularly when compared to the over-priced dives in Midtown.

reviews.title: Perfect Hotel!
reviews.text: Nothing but kudos for this place from check in to check out...the room, the staff nothing short of excellent. The view from the room overlooking the trade center and the river beyond, incredible. Here for a weekend and its the kind of quiet you want. Skip all the restaurant recommendations...Church and Day is first rate..you won't be dissapointed. Traveller who's spends 80 nights a year in hotels. This place is a four star rating. Not above...but a solid four. Loved having Starbucksa next door as the only complaint is the lack of coffee maker in the room. And thats the only complaint.

reviews.title: great choice for a family
reviews.text: Could not find fault with it. The best hotel I have stayed in for a long long time. After reading many reviews here we finally decided on the millenium hilton. Just go for it. You wont regret it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here for 2 nights in May. The hotel is in a great location in the financial district, next door to multiple subway stations and the Century 21 department store, as well as across the street from the 9/11 Memorial site. Our room on the 46th floor had a great view of it. If you get a room high enough, the hi-speed elevators will make your ears pop.
reviews.title: Great view and very convenient
Great Location
reviews.text: The front desk, concierge and bell hop staff are all friendly and helpful. We didn't use room service because there are so many dining options nearby and the prices were pretty high anyway. There's a lot of construction going on in the area, not just at the WTC, but that's not the hotel's fault. We will definitely stay here again.

I spent almost a week at the hotel while in New York on business. The location is fantastic as it's so close to the financial centre and the subway is across the road. My room (I had to change once as there wasn't a safe in the first room) had a great view out over the world trade centre building site (and memorial).
reviews.title: Good option
Great hotel, friendly staff, clean rooms - would definitely stay here again!
reviews.text: The breakfast as the hotel is a little pricy, but very good. The hotel also helped us in booking tickets for shows and for the WTC memorial. Nice little bar downstairs in the lobby which was well positioned before heading out for dinner. My only gripe would be the cost of daily WiFi, which really adds up and there is no option for a cheaper time period (you have to pay for 24 hour access, regardless of whether you are in the room or not) so a full day in the office and dinner meant paying for 24 hours and using 1 at the most.
Great location for business, bit of a long way to get up to Midtown and Central Park.
reviews.title: Great for young teens

reviews.text: Reviewed this hotel last year & returned for another visit in July. Reasonable price, CLEAN, comfortable beds, awesome room service for breakfast - on time, amazing views of the city! Why would you stay anywhere else? The subway is a very short walk & cabs are always at the side door. This is the place to stay in NYC.
reviews.title: Fantastic - Again!

reviews.text: The hotel is in desperate need of a remodel. The carpets in the elevators & rooms are filthy. The location of the hotel & the views are outstanding. The rooms are beyond ugly, Beige curtains, beige walls, beige and brown carpet...UGLY! The lobby is weay too small for the size of the hotel. The 2 unisex, single bathrooms in the lobby were dirty & had lines 5 deep throughout the day. Why do the most expensive hotels charge for Internet? $14.95 per day is a rip-off. Numerous subways stops steps away from the front door are a huge plus.
reviews.title: Rooms need renovated
Governor's Suite July 2013
reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband for our anniversary. We were late to check-in and the room we had requested was no longer available. The front desk staff saw our disappointment, found out it was our anniversary and gave us the governor's suite. An unbelievable room with two bedrooms, living/dining room, small kitchen and 2.5 bathrooms. 55th floor. Amazing views. I always worry about elevator service when staying on a high floor. Didn't have any problems, even during the busy morning hours when the business people were on their way to work. This hotel is very convenient to everything. I didnt notice any construction noise. I felt safe on the hotel premises. We are frequent New York visitors and I would definitely stay here again -even without the Governor's Suite. The only caveat is that I felt that the breakfast was severely overpriced. But there's a Starbucks in the building and plenty of other breakfast options nearby. Thumbs up for Millenium Hilton.

My husband and I stated here for a weekend getaway without kids. The front desk staff was friendly and accommodating. All rooms have a view of the 9-11 memorial and the water. The room was spacious and clean...bed was comfy also. Great location for getting to Brooklyn. We will stay here again!
reviews.title: Super clean hotel and room!

reviews.text: When I arrived at this hotel I was expecting greatness! It wasn't even close. The one good thing about this hotel is the location. It is directly across from the World Trade Center and steps away from Wall Street. The room however fell short on all levels. When I opened the door, there was a strong awful odor that gave me an instant headache. I was on the World Trade Center side of the building which had 24x7 construction noise and lights all night long which made it impossible to get a decent nights sleep. There was an influx of homeless individuals hanging around outside which made it uncomfortable to leave the building. Unfortunately when I'd requested to be moved to another room I couldn't because the hotel was sold out. As a result, I checked out and went to the W. It made for a much more pleasant trip.
reviews.title: Not Impressed!

reviews.text: Booked a room on hotwire for $202 (174 + tax) a few days before our Friday night visit. We called a day earlier to ask if we could check in at noon and receptionist was frosty, said she couldn't guarantee anything. Arrival was easy; there's an ACE and 123 stop (Chambers St) just steps from the hotel. We arrived at noon and the front desk clerk was gracious and accomodating and found us a room on the 41st floor facing the world trade center site and the river. Great views. Decor was generic but the bed was comfortable and linens pristine. Bathroom was decently sized, had a nice tub, Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries, and a shaving mirror. This was definitely a nice business-type hotel. Location was perfect for us because we prefer downtown and it was nice to be close to Brooklyn where our friends live. Cons included lack of decent food (except a deli) around the corner. Plus, this part of the city is quieter and you can get anywhere in minutes using the subway. Front desk was exceptionally friendly and helpful - they are what makes this place stand out.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, and Great staff
Millenium Hilton - You Can't Go Wrong Here !!
reviews.text: I read all the reviews with skepticism. I've been disappointed before with New York hotels. This time, however, I was not. From the moment you walk off the sidewalk, you realize this hotel is upscale. The location is incredible: right across the street from the World Trade Center plaza and in walking distance to many attractions. There are also several wonderful restaurants within a few blocks. Be sure to check out St. Paul's Chapel right next door. It was built in 1766 and has a cemetary on the grounds with stones dating back to the 1700's. George Washington has a special pew in the church. This was a resting spot for the volunteers in the 9/11 tragedy and there is a lot of memorabilia and photos on display. A must-see. But get there early - as I recall visiting hours end around 3 p.m.

As for the hotel, the rooms are not large, but they are very comfortable and extremely clean. The beds are superb with down comforters, and each room has a large flat panel television. The hotel is well constructed and the rooms are quiet. The only noise you will hear is the plumbing, but I doubt there is anything that could be done about that. As you might expect, the food here is expensive. I only had the breakfast buffet (once), but it set me back around $20. Pricey by anyone's standards.
reviews.title: Great...for the price!
Wonderful Experience - Exceptional Customer Service
reviews.text: The views are incredible. I stayed on the 23rd floor and had a perfect view straight down into "ground zero". It really made me reflect on the heroism shown and the lives lost in that tragedy.
The service at this hotel is also superb. I felt like the staff went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect. From the front desk to the bellmen, they were all just top-notch.
reviews.title: Superb 10 out 10

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husbend and I stayed in this HIlton for 3 nights in the end of June. Location was great, close to Underground station and a shopping centre + of course WDC towers monument. We expected a little bit more for the price of the twinroom. Air conditioning was loud and really dirty, bathroom standard size and shower ok. Safety box in the room was not working and they couldnt fix it during our stay. Breakfast was standard, really the same food every morning. During one night we got a firealarm from 33rd floor (our room was is 29th), that the hotel is burning....lucky us the alarm was fake. I haven´t been in any other hotel in NY so, I cant really compare this hotel to any other. Still, next time I will try something else.
reviews.title: First visit in NY
Great experience
reviews.text: My husband was traveling to NYC on business, so we brought the entire family for a week of fun in NY. The hotel selection was not our choice for his business trip, but we decided to extend the stay at this location to keep things easier. It's not the most luxurious hotel, but it is very nice. The bedding and beds were very comfortable, and the rooms were not super tiny. We were happy with the pool area, which we used quite a few times and were the only ones in the pool! We also used the fitness center a few times and had no problem with finding equipment to use. We did have an issue with our room that was very frustrating, but the hotel management went over and above to fix the problem and make sure that we were comfortable. We were pleasantly surprised when we received a knock on the door one evening with a plate of fruits and cheeses along with a bottle of Pellegrino. There was also a hand written note from the management. We understand that things won't always be perfect with a hotel stay, but to have the hotel management show concern for the issue made for a great experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hilton has a great location across the street from the WTC site, Century 21 store, and a short walk to battery park. Our check-in took longer that expected with the desk clerk scrutinizing our ID,s like she was comparing us to a most wanted list. We were told we would not receive Hilton points because we booked through priceline which is the first time I ever heard of that policy. The room was very clean, however the safe did not work. This Hotel did not meet our expectations.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I came up from Maryland for a wedding. The entire staff was friendly and extremely helpful. The room was quiet and clean. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. We took a handicap access room because it was opposite of the World trade Center construction. The only complaint was the water puddle that accumulated outside of the shower.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I am a Hilton Diamond member and stayed for two nights on business. Was given a room on high floor with a great view of the Freedom tower. Not sure I would call this an upgrade as the room was rather small. Bed was so so, slept on much better beds at a Hilton. Pillows were nice!
reviews.title: Hilton Diamond Review

reviews.text: This was just another business trip and the hotel met my expectations for another metrolpolitan hilton. The incredible experience was looking down over a snow covered ground zero. All construction activity had stopped because of the weather and it was both sobering and impressive.
reviews.title: Looking over ground zero - amazing experience

reviews.text: Brought grandchildren to see July 4th Fireworks on the Hudson - we could have seen them from our gorgeous room! $180 - 5 star - in NYC - are you kidding!!! It was spectacular. Gramma and Grampa are heroes!
reviews.title: Breathtaking
Consistently Good
reviews.text: I have stayed here a dozen times in the last two years, most recently on July 9. The hotel sits next to the old World Trade Center site and was completely renovated after 9/11. The hotel is sleek, modern and comfortable. The standard rooms are small, but very comfortable. The room decor is also modern and minimalist in a good way. Light wood furniture; glass tops on the dresser and desk; large flat screen televisions. I've eaten in the restaurant many times and have been happy with the food. The continental breakfast used to be better and has been scaled back a little of late, but it's ok. It's several years out now since the renovation, but everything is still in very nice shape. Noise has sometimes been a problem with the continuous day/evening work on the World Trade Center site, and most of the rooms face that direction. There are rooms on each end of the hotel that face the opposite direction and they are quieter (although the view isn't nearly as interesting). These rooms are also significantly bigger than the typical rooms facing the WTC site. I've stayed in four of these end rooms, and it seems to be hit or miss if you get one. I've attached some pictures of one of these bigger rooms, so for the standard room, imagine something much narrower. The staff is courteous and professional. One extra bonus of the hotel is that it is also right next to the Century 21 department store. I definitely recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for two nights over the 4th of July weekend. Being Gold HHonors members, we have used points to stay in most of the Hilton properties in NYC. We chose this hotel with the hopes of being able to see the fireworks from our room. We weren't disappointed. Using our points and reserving on line, I was offered the opportunity to select to an upgrade. I chose all upgrades and at check-in we got a King Jr. Suite with a city view. It cost an extra $49/N which was a bargain for the view! We were on the 34th floor, (room 3411)a 2 room suite with a first room with a sofa, lounge chair, desk, honor bar and a flat screen TV then the bathroom (great water pressure!!) and a nice size bedroom with king bed and large flat screen TV. The best part was the floor to ceiling windows with a spectacular viewsof the Hudson River, Empire State Building and the WTC site. This was a corner room, so views really spanned from the Hudson on one side to the Brooklyn Bridge on the other. We were able to see both the Macy's fireworks and those at Liberty State Park. It was such a clear night that we could even see fireworks in the distance all around NJ and LI. The hotel is located downtown and if you are looking for nightlife closeby, you would probably prefer the midtown area; however, if you want to be close to everything (many subway lines within walking distance, 2 within a block) and like the peace and quiet, then this is a great choice. In my opinion, you will not get a better value in NYC. This is a lovely hotel in a very safe neighborhood. We were given the choice of free breakfast, free internet or 1000 points as Gold members. We chose the breakfast, which was adequate for a continental breakfast. (Yes, as previously mentioned they charge $24 for the buffet which is high, but perhaps not for NYC.) They also had an option to upgrade to a 'real' breakfast for $6.50. With all the great food options in NYC, we only wanted a bit of breakfast so never bothered with more than the buffet. We looked at the fitness room and pool, but never had time to use them. They looked nice and clean. All the staff we encountered was very pleasant and helpful. We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, rooms and value in NYC

reviews.text: P.S. - Century 21 department store is next door. It is a must experience if you like shopping for bargains! St. Paul's Church has a very moving memorial and tribute to 9/11 which is also next door.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Great Stay---though out of the way for tourists
reviews.text: My wife and I spent six nights at the Millenium Hilton during our first ever stay in New York City.
We were on an award stay from Hilton, and they put us in a very nice 25th floor two-room suite over looking Ground Zero---which can only be described as a sobering view.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel
Perfect Views, Wonderful NYC Retreat!
reviews.text: Because of our frequent travel status, we did receive free breakfast coupons, which were great because the breakfast buffet (while very good) costs roughly $25 a head. There are a bunch of places within walking distance for breakfast and lunch, though you will find your dinner options a little limited.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: The room was very clean and upscale. The beds were quite comfortable, and the sitting room had a fridge, work area, and separate sitting area. The bathroom had a great shower, and the bedroom had a very large flat screen television.
If anyone in your crowd likes to shop, the hotel is located right next door to Century 21---which for those of you from the south, is a little like a Steinmart or TJ Maxx on steriods.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Millenium Hotel with my wife for two night recently to attend a wedding at the South Street Seaport, about 3/4 mile away. The hotel is located smack-dab across the street from Ground Zero has clearly been renovated extensively since then.
reviews.title: Top-End Mid-Priced Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a (very) high rise. We stayed on the 51st floor with (for better or for worse) one of the most impactful views of the World Trade Center memorial park. The view of the Brooklyn Bridge from the elevator lobby was unbelievable.
reviews.title: Long weekend in NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself (king bed) was not gigantic but incredibly modern, clean and updated - among the nicest I've seen. The staff stopped by around 6pm both nights to bring chocolates, turn down the sheets, and provide fresh towels (at our request).
reviews.title: Hotel staff needs training

reviews.text: The lobby is busy with lots of tourists, as this is a big hotel and getting a cab wasn't a challenge, but not immediate either. Expect a ten minute wait.
reviews.title: Location, Location...
Great location, but business hotel with no wifi in rooms????
reviews.text: One of the best features was the concierge (Charles?) who got us immediate reservations for brunch at Sarabeths (1.0 mile away) and who steered us to another really good local and cool breakfast place.

We truly enjoyed staying in this hotel. When we arrived we asked for a different type of room and hotel staff made the change with a very positive attitude. All members of the hotel staff were polite and friendly. The room was wonderful, tastefully decorated with very comfortable beds, and a great view of Ground Zero. One day I was not feeling well and decided to stay in my room with the "no disturb" sign outside my door. Later that day I got a polite call from housekeeping services asking if everything was ok and offering to bring to the room anything I might need. We travel to New York at least once a year and this has been the best hotel experience we have ever had.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — The room and the hotel staff

reviews.text: We booked two rooms at this property from the 20th - 27th October '07. Location was great, downtown, close to Wall Street, Century 21, South Seaport and the like. We got a wonderful and cheerful welcome - they sent us a large platter of strawberries dipped in chocolate when we checked in!
reviews.title: Expensive but very professional
All round winner
reviews.text: The room was lovely, nice large Plasma TV, fantastic view of the properties in front, Ground Zero right beneath us, lovely bathrooms stacked with Crabtree & Evelyn products. Very very comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was way above standard, all you needed was to call and someone would be up in the room in a whisk. Room service food was simply fantastic, though very very expensive. There are lots and lots of places to eat nearby, so one can easily walk to the food!
reviews.title: Met expectations

reviews.text: Our 7 days there were dotted with excellent service, a professional concierge, very happy door men and all in all - a great experience. Room size was large (for New York), our double king bed was extremely comfortable. Lots of space to keep your bags, ironing board and steam iron provided in each room (that helped a lot before my meetings!), Lavazza coffee and tea maker which was replenished each time you used it.
reviews.title: Thank Goodness for the Hilton !!

reviews.text: Stayed here a few times in 2010/11, booked a junior suite with city view. They are usually located on the higher floors, and noice from the ground zero reconstruction is minimal. The view was spectacular, but I guess it is only temporary due to the resurrection on ground zero. A clean and tidy hotel, suits a short stay in the Big Apple!
reviews.title: JS with city view

reviews.text: A little pricey if you book last minute, but I was on the 30th floor overlooking the WTC site and it was an amazing view. Great location, HUGE room! Very comfortable bed, large bathroom, like I said, HUGE room! I was there for work and had a great work area, couch, 2 tv's, nice bed. I know Hotel Room Service is expensive, be warned. That's the main drawback. My average breakfast totaled out at over $50. Other than that, its a great hotel!
reviews.title: Amazing views, very clean.

reviews.text: Only a brief one night stay, only used the room (not the spa, gym or restaurants)but that was clean and well equipped as I would like it to be. The internet was extra, at $15.95 a night. (Go to the Pret a couple of blocks north, it is free there)
reviews.title: Good quality as you would like to expect of a millennium Hilton.

reviews.text: I was up on floor 34 so it was relatively quiet, although not enough to go without earplugs. (Anyone know of a NYC hotel that is?)
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Would stay again.
reviews.title: Better than a park bench?

reviews.text: I chose the Millenium Hilton for a two night stay in early April 2005 on the strength of the reviews on this site. I was not disappointed. I will definitely stay here again. I would highly recommend this property for the following reasons:
reviews.title: Outstanding Experience
Great stay
reviews.text: 1) Excellent subway access, a critical feature in a NYC hotel. Cortlandt Street station (R and W trains) is literally at the entrance stairs to the hotel. Many other subway lines (2,3,E,4,5,6) are within a couple of blocks.

reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.text: 2) The 42 inch plasma TVs are a fun novelty for those of us who would never spend the money to own one ourselves.
3) Views - I was on the 41st floor and had a fantastic view of the city.
reviews.title: Modern Hotel with great views
Hilton in Lower Manhattan
reviews.text: 4) Very comfortable bed.

My husband and I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights late December. Our room was very pleasant and comfortable. It was great to be so close to the subway until the strike!! However we were able to use the PATH train to get to 33rd street. Staff were OK but didn't help at all in terms of how to get to JFK during a transit strike - we got good advice from fellow travellers on the trains that were running. No tea or coffe facilities in room and very expensive restaurant/bar. Would recommend the Italian restaurant ECCO which is about 15 minutes walk away and also the Salaam (not sure of spelling) Bombay - both excellent and not too expensive. The church next door is well worth a visit as it has moving displays re. 9/11 - you could walk past it and not know!
reviews.title: Very enjoyable - just a couple of minus points

reviews.text: I've booked this hotel through Hotwire and paid 177$ a night. During Christmas time in New York, this is cheap rate. For the price, the Millenium Hilton was beyond our expectations. Great view on Ground Zero, large room(in New York standards), exceptionnally confortable bed. But if I would have paid the rack rate of 400$ US, I don't think my review would have been the same. Don't forget that this hotel is in the Lower part of Manhattan, 10-15 minutes away from Times Square by subway. The financial district is also very deserted on week-ends and at night.
reviews.title: Good Lower Manhattan Hotel

reviews.text: The Millenium Hilton is an ok hotel in an ok location but there are many better options in New York. the rooms are tired and the bathrooms need updating. The facilities in the room are sparse without even a trouser press or even bathrobes unless you ask! the rooms are quite noisy on every floor. The staff are friendly-ish. The restaurant has a very limited choice. Overall the hotel is fine if you need to stay downtown or have a corporate arrangement but if you are a tourist in New York, its only key advantage is proximity to Ground Zero and Century21 (the discount department store).
reviews.title: Only if you have to....
Highly recommend
reviews.text: Just got back from a 3 day trip to Manhattan and stayed at the Millenium Hilton. It was fantastic. Very clean, excellent amenities, and the staff was courteous and helpful. And it's right next to Ground Zero. The only downside...expensive!! But everything in Manhattan is expensive. If I have to pay around $400 for a hotel room in New York, I might as well stay at a four star luxury such as the Millenium, which by the way, has a 42 inch flatscreen in every room. I recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a reliable place for a trip to Manhattan.
I just joined this great site and felt I owed a post.
reviews.title: Didn't care for it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located right next to Ground Zero..therefore it is a bit noisy, especially through the night! However, we stayed in a Junior Suite on the 23 floor and the room was very clean, and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We were not unecessarily bothered by them, and the rooms are of a good size and standard. We particuarly liked the Lavazza coffee maker in the room. We would definately stay here again
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

likes.disliked: — The noise from ground zero building works

reviews.title: Hilton Millenium is good, but not great
reviews.text: The Hilton Millenium is located across the street from the WTC complex and most of the rooms overlook the area, which can be a bit depressing. If you can handle that, the hotel is located in a great location. Several subway stops are within a couple of blocks and the area is a little less hectic than mid-town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself is pretty nice, with a very nice plasma TV (but what are you doing watching TV in NYC?). The service is so-so. The construction around the hotel can be pretty aggrevating. The construction noise isn't that bad, but all the sidewalks have been narrowed and with all the street vendors around it can be very slow to get back to the hotel from the subway.
reviews.title: Will go back...

reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a 5 day trip to NY and we had a fantastic time. Hotel room was 4111 junior suite which had three huge windows all with fantastic views. Looking down over the WTC site and across to the Statue of Liberty, looking up Broadway towards the Empire State Bldg and across towards the Brooklyn Bridge. Found hotel staff very helpful and friendly, no complaints there.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Millennium Hilton

reviews.text: We did find the room a little noisy from work going on below at the WTC , sometimes work would start very early in the morning (even Sunday) and end quite late. That said the views from the room made up for it.
reviews.title: Worst Service in NY!!!
Great Hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights and would definately stay there again. We had a high floor room with a view of ground zero and the hudson river. The room was of average size, clean and comfortable, the 42" TV is a good addition, although we would have liked bath robes too.

reviews.title: thin walls you can hear the people next door
reviews.text: The staff were both friendly and helpful and the room service was good. We have never stayed downtown before but when the subway tickets are so cheap and there are plenty of things to do and see close by, we would recommend it.

reviews.title: Millenium Hilton - a great option
reviews.text: I stayed for 4 nights and paid over $1,300.00. Three of the nights neighbors was partying till 3 am. These walls are paper thin. We could hear everything and I mean everything. I complain to the manager, but they just said they were sorry and did little to calm the situation. We couldn't sleep at night and had to sleep in the morning to catch up. I will never sleep at this place again and will tell everyone our horrible experience.

reviews.title: Oh my god!
reviews.text: After struggling to find a hotel room under $250, I finally used priceline and got the Millenium Hilton for $200/night. I would definitely recommend this hotel. From what I understand the majority of the rooms have king-sized beds and views of ground zero, which also means views of the Hudson river. My husband and I didn't come here to see ground zero but rather to visit with friends but this hotel is perfectly located for those doing the touristy thing. It's close to the subway (1,9, A, C, E) and directly across the street from the PATH train. The area has everything you would need - coffee shops, shopping, etc. I expected downtown to be desolate but it isn't. The hotel is very clean and the rooms have recently been renovated. Although the rooms are probably typical NYC size (small) they are so well-designed that you hardly realize it. Our room had a plasma tv, a sleek desk with internet access, a sitting chair, a king sized bed and huge windows looking out over NY. The bathroom was huge and had big towels and crabtree & evelyn products. The only bummer was that there was not a coffee maker in our room so we had to schlep downstairs to get some. We also made the mistake of eating breakfast in the hotel restaurant one morning. Although it was good, it cost us $20/person. Pretty hefty when we could have crossed the street and gotten the same thing for half the price. Overall, I would stay here again in a heartbeat and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC.

reviews.title: Great Choice
reviews.text: My favorite Hotel in New York City - and I have stayed at quite a few. From the moment you walk thru the beautiful revolving doors - you just know. Due to a celebration - they were so kind to give us the 54th floor with a breathtaking view. I am very particular when it comes to cleaniness and the room could not have been any cleaner. We had 2 beautiful bathrooms (separate ones was great - lol) Girls, lots of room to put all our stuff! Loved the flat screen T.V. in the wall - everything was just so perfect. The only thing to watch for is ordering room service - wow it could be real expensive - but we had so much fun doing it once - it was all worthed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my second time at this hotel. The last time I stayed was April 2006. The Hilton is located right across from the WTC site and was renovated after 9/11, it has all updated fixtures and flat screen TVs. They have reopened the main entrance in the last year and the lobby seemed much more put together since the last time I was there.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — I liked being out of midtown and exploring lower Manhattan.
likes.disliked: — Its a pretty good haul to midtown.

reviews.title: New Years Stay at the Millenium
reviews.text: The rooms are a good size by NYC standards and the view is tremendous (it’s interesting to see the construction of the WTC site). Its located next to the Fulton subway station and within three blocks you can get a subway to anywhere in NYC. My wife and I took advantage of the downtown location to explore some of the small museums in Lower Manhattan and had a great three days.

reviews.title: Loved the Millenium
reviews.text: There are plenty of pubs and bars in the Financial District and on Reade and Chambers street, but it is very much an after work crowd.
I’m pretty self sufficient so I didn’t really have any contact with anyone who works there, nor did I need to, everything was very smooth.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: I recommend it for people who have business in the Financial District and people who are looking at staying in a different part of NY.
reviews.title: Will Never Stay Here Again

reviews.text: Having earlier stayed in a hotel that set the bar for elegance and service, I was first struck with how unfriendly the reception staff was. The woman acted like she was doing me a grudging favor.
reviews.title: Impressive but not comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was stark, with chrome and little in the way of decoration. The bathroom was strange. I guess it was handicapped accessible, because there was no barrier to keep the water from flowing onto the floor whenever the shower was on. There was constant noise (construction?) throughout the night. They charged for internet, for crying out loud. Who does that anymore? The bed was small and not especially comfortable.
reviews.title: Great room every time

reviews.text: I booked the room though a discount travel service, so maybe the room and service reflected what the hotel thought of people who do that. Whatever the reason, I wasn't amused, and would not recommend the Millenium to a friend. Having said that, my college-aged son and his girlfriend were impressed.
reviews.title: Strongly Recommended

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel multiple times, the rooms are great and location is stellar. I will be back again next year and look forward to my stay at this hotel again next year (or sooner).
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Millenium Hilton

reviews.text: Great NYC downtown hotel, with new WTC view, at reasonable prices and a very helpful and nice staff
reviews.title: About as close to Ground Zero as you can get

reviews.text: Excellent rooms and service and a great location. Good value for Manhattan. No problems whatsoever.
reviews.title: A top hotel

reviews.text: Stayed with my girlfriend in this hotel from a Friday to Sunday - checked in from another hotel at 9am with no problem even though check in time was 3pm - requested a "high floor" on reservation and got it (53/55) the view was incredible.
reviews.title: Great VIEW, Great Room, Great Staff, GREAT PRICE

reviews.text: Everything about the hotel seemed clean and new (I gather it was renovated post 9/11) – operable slit window was great as the weather was nice and cool - large plasma tv a plus, but went largely unwatched as there is so much to do outside.
reviews.title: July 4th Holiday at the Millenium Hilton
Fantastic view
reviews.text: The bellman were nice and helpful, they kept our baggage for us when we checked out as we took a late flight from JFK - The A train / Air Train to JFK worked fine for me but I would allow 3 hours prior to departure to be on the safe side.

reviews.title: Great deal and good service
reviews.text: The view, especially the sunset was amazing – things to do nearby include Battery Park City, The Federal Reserve of New York, New York Stock Exchange (from the outside-no tours) A jogging / bike path (Westside Greenway) running from Battery Park City past the World Financial Center up the Cloisters Museum (past GW bridge). Friday Sunset. Sunday Brunch sails on SV Ventura from North Cove Harbor (WFC) - Walk across the Brooklyn Bridge. J&R Music world for electronics of all types. A Starbucks on every block.

reviews.title: Top option in SOHO
reviews.text: We've stayed here a couple of times before and each time has been enjoyable. Rooms are clean and updated and staff are friendly and helpful. Most rooms have a terrific view of the WTC construction site and elevator lobbies a good view towards Brooklyn. A great concierge is worth a fortune and in Joseph they have one, he even helped me find a place to get a new EZpass. Internet is ethernet, not wifi, but works well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am bias... I am a HHonors Diamond Member... so, I am bias...
reviews.title: It's OK experience

reviews.text: The hotel is a bit rundown. The room decor looked tired. Seems the same as the last time I went to NYC (before 911).
reviews.title: Changed perspective; changed offerings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was walking distance to Wall Street and next to Century 21. WOW! Commuting to NEWARK was easy via PATH.
reviews.title: You can't go wrong staying here

reviews.text: I get upgraded to junior suite but overlooking at the 911 site. The bed and pillow was GREAT! Breakfast was disappointed.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have originally booked a 3* hotel on W43rd St, but after reading very bad reviews on here, we had second thoughts. I looked on the Hilton website, and found out that rooms in the Millenium were only £5 per night extra!! We paid another £5 per night to get a garaunteed 35th floor or above (comes under "city view" on the room selection).
reviews.title: What an amazing hotel!

likes.liked: — The amazing views from our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was absolutely amazing - despite being "down town" it was only a $5 taxi or 10min underground ride to Times Square. It is very easy walking distance to the Brooklyn Bridge, Wall Street, the ferry to Statue of Liberty, China Town, Little Italy and Grenwich Village.
reviews.title: Honneymooners Beware!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is gorgeous - you really feel like you are staying in somewhere a cut above the rest! The rooms do look over Ground Zero, but only if you stand right next to window and look down. The view straight out of the window was fantastic, and the sun set right between the Trade Plazza buildings opposite. Its a truely amazing sight! The rooms aren't big, but you have more than enough space. The bathrooms are really nice (and the Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries are a very nice touch!)
reviews.title: Efficient, priced to compete, stylish rooms

likes.liked: — Price, quiet, all our needs were met

reviews.title: Pleasant stay with a few blips..
reviews.text: The Ground Zero site is very moving, but is actually worth visiting. The memorial display has been put together very tastefully and actually moves you to tears. I never worried about staying at the hotel because of it, and I actually felt that I was helping the regeneration of the area by staying at the hotel. Some poeple have commented on the building noise, but to be honest once you have the airconditioning on it more than blocks it out - it never woke us up to put it that way.
New York is a truely amazing city - and Millenium Hilton is a fantastic base to explore. If we go back to New York, we would definately stay there again!
reviews.title: Expensive but beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As you can tell by the title we very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel...everything went amazingly smooth while we were there...the room was fantastic...a view you couldnt believe...overlooking the WTC site...and so clean with lots of room to spread out and relax...the staff was excellent with any questions we had...the concierge was a great resource and we asked them so many questions and they had an answer for everyone of them...from where to eat to what to do...the only thing that I wasnt too crazy about was the distance from Times Square and all the main attractions...taxi cab ride was about 15-20 dollars but if you dont mind manning the subway than that would be a cheaper way of going around the city...we really cant say enough good things about the hotel...it was everything we were hoping for and more and will be staying there again when we visit NYC!!!!
reviews.title: you have to stay here!!!!

likes.liked: — the service by the staff...check in and check out and the concierge!!!
likes.disliked: — the distance from main attractions like TImes Square and Central Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights at the beginning of a USA holiday. Have visited NYC many times and recognised that the area was not the best location for Manhattan, but knew it was convenient for public transport .
reviews.title: A room with a (superb) view

reviews.text: The weekend rate was fantastic and I booked a corner suite for arouhnd £160 per night. The room was on the 51st floor and looked down onto Ground Zero, the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island from one aspect and from the other, Brooklyn Bridge. The views are fabulous and made the stay very special; you could not foregt what city you were in!
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: The room was also a very good size, nicely appointed, flat screen TV and a conmfortable and very big bed. Decent bathroom. Would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In town for a family wedding. Excellent accomodations. Room was super clean. Bed was comfortable to the max. I did not use pool, but it sure looked good.
reviews.title: Romantic New Year City Break

likes.disliked: — Very proffesional staff that were not overly friendly

reviews.text: We stayed at the Millennium Hilton from 8-12 April, as part of an 18th Birthday present for our son.
reviews.title: Room With A View!

reviews.text: Although not in the tourist part of Manhattan it is conveniently located right next to the subway and is in close proximity to Battery Park, Wall Street and the Staten Island Ferry.
reviews.title: Corner 11 Jr Suites

reviews.text: We had a corner Junior Suite located on the 44th floor (ending 11) which had amazing views of the New York skyline including the Empire State Building and directly down on the 9/11 Memorial Site. The original foot prints of the twin towers have been converted into two huge waterfalls with a small garden. Next to the original North Tower, a new tower called The Freedoom Tower is rising up into the sky and should be completed by 2015, with 3 smaller towers also being built.
reviews.title: Okay Hotel

reviews.text: The room was quiet, clean and comfortable with a large bed and a pull out sofa (fine for an 18 year old) and are separated by a short hallway and the bathroom. There were also two TV's in the room and tea/coffee making facilities. The decor could probably do with some renovation as perhaps the outside corridors.
reviews.title: Nice location, old but in good shape.

reviews.text: Another plus for the hotel is that it has a swimming pool on the 5th floor, which is very welcoming after spending a day walking round the city.
reviews.title: A solid choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights here during some of the hottest NYC weather I can ever remember!
reviews.title: Tremendous value in Lower Manhattan

reviews.text: Arrived early Thursday afternoon (3pm-ish) and check in was quick but impersonal. No real warmth of welcome from the man who served us. We did have a room ready but I noticed that the man checking in next to us was told there would be a 20-30 min wait until his room ‘type’ was ready. I had pre-booked a package on the Hilton website – the city suite saver package for $888 dollars. The actual room rate was $255 but they pile on 3 or 4 separate taxes on top. Still, for Manhattan this was pretty decent in terms of cost.
reviews.title: Very clean room

reviews.text: The reception area was busy but brilliantly air conditioned. There is a small bar off to the right of reception which was always popular and a small gift shop to the left. Overall it’s a very small space for such a large building but it’s cool, clean and comfortable. Door men were great a getting cabs – didn’t use the concierge but that facility looked well used.
reviews.title: Ticks all boxes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was on the 47th floor and was reached by speedy elevators for which we didn’t have to wait – the suite bedroom primarily overlooked the WTC rebuilding project and the Hudson. We also had a clear view of the Empire State building and mid town from the sitting area which was truly stunning at night. Construction is going on but we never experienced any loud noise – in fact I thought it was fascinating to watch the progress of the whole site – and very moving to look down on the “footprints” of the destroyed towers. Although we did not visit the area, the new memorial park looked both beautiful and tasteful – well done New York.
reviews.title: The Best for the Money

reviews.text: The room was well air conditioned (essential in the heat), clean and well stocked – coffee and bathroom amenities were replenished daily. There were robes along with an umbrella and iron/ing board and mini bar – everything you expect from a Hilton. There were two large flat TVs but only a few channels were watchable as the picture quality was so poor. We asked at reception for at least one TV to be fixed so that my OH could watch a soccer match from the Euro 12 tournament but it never was. The shower pressure was OK but like most hotels these days, you’d struggle to rinse really long hair quickly!
reviews.title: What a View !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great hotel for the accomodations and location. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Views, if you're on the upper floors are really nice! Only complaint is the temp. in the room. We were there the weekend of Mar. 29-31. The temp in the room never got below 75 degrees - most of the time it was 78 degrees. That was with the fan going and the window open - only one window opens 2 inches so it really didn't help. The staff explained it was because the hotel was in the process of switching over heat to AC. Very uncomfortable for sleeping - we would definitely stay here again, just not during this time of year.
reviews.title: Great location, but seasons matter

reviews.text: My Mum and I have just spent the weekend in this hotel.
reviews.title: Friday to Monday Stay
Good Rooms, Poor staff
reviews.text: Would recommend staying here over a weekend. The hotel was lovely and staff very helpful. Our room was very clean and looked over on to Ground Zero and over the river to new jersey, what amazing views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Convenient spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had one meal in hotel very good but expensive. Drinks were expensive too.
reviews.title: Great Location and Staff with old furnishings and carpet in guest rooms.

reviews.text: As a Hilton Diamond member, I was upgraded to a junior suite which was very modern and nice. We had a nice dinner at the bar on the 3rd floor and an enjoyable continental breakfast. I was in touch with Mr. Ryan Kinch before my stay. He was extremely helpful and answered all my questions. I look forward to staying here again in the near future.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: If 79% of Trip Advisor reviewers liked this property- then I must call foul. This hotel should not have Hilton's name on it.
reviews.title: You have better choices nearby

reviews.text: Very rough hotel, with no fluent English speaking people on staff to resolve issues on Saturday morning. The staff does however like to talk loudly over you in their wish to communicate what is not possible.
reviews.title: Stay here on business

reviews.text: Not clean, not Honors- friendly and not worth booking. Check out Andaz Wall Street- or anything of that caliber.
reviews.title: Honors members beware

reviews.text: I've stayed here a number of times on business and it's always been quite nice. The junior suites are great, if you can get upgraded, it's a nice perk. The restaurant is just ok, but certainly adequate. Love the lobby bar. Great locations by the PATH.
reviews.title: Nice hotel located in the financial district

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wanting to get away for the weekend to NYC, we booked this hotel after many positive reviews here on tripadvisor, and I don't think we'll stay at any other NYC hotel. For the price this hotel can't be beat.
reviews.title: Best value in NYC
Timmy's 40th Birthday Stay
reviews.text: Interestingly, the only downside to the hotel is its location. It's way down next to the WTC, meaning it's at the tip of southern Manhattan. But that's OK because the hotel is right outside the entranceway to the WTC subway stop on the E train. My wife and I arrived by bus at Penn Station (also on the E line), and a few stops later, was at the door to the Hilton. Plus, all the hotspots in Manhattan are served on the blue (A, C, E) line: Times Square, Columbus Circle/Central Park, Empire State Building, etc. Can't beat the convenience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was impeccable. We asked room service to send up toothpaste, and in timely fashion, a gentleman arrived at our door with the goods. A few minutes after that, we got a phone call from Housekeeping asking us if the toothpaste was delivered. Was a nice touch since this was the first time I had ever experienced a follow-up call, and I've stayed at many more upscale hotels.
reviews.title: Best choice in NYC

reviews.text: We got a king-size bedroom and as a previous poster noted, the window view was of the WTC construction site. Unlike the previous poster, I couldn't hear a thing outside our window, and we were on the 20th floor, so not too high up. Noise was not a problem.
reviews.title: Smoker Beware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a little on the small side, but that is to be expected in Manhattan. The decor was modern, and the plasma TV was a very nice touch (not to mention space saving!). The bathroom and bedsheets were all clean...no complaints.
reviews.title: Not the best

likes.disliked: — no coffee \ refrigerator \ free wireless internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No problems at all. Room was on the 47th floor which took the elevator 25 seconds to get to (your ears pop). Room overlooked WTC, so if that an issue for you then best to avoid. Staff very pleasant and helpful when we needed them. Outside the door is the subway, next door is Century 21, opposite was the PATH train for getting from Newark to Hilton, took 40 minutes and cost only $8, we were lucky with the connections mind you. Plasma is a bonus, rubbish on US TV with adverts every 5 minutes meant we never really watched it though!
reviews.title: Just Perfect

likes.disliked: — Having to get up to tread the streets of NY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest point given that we were out all day was the most comfortable bed that they claim was just that. I have never slept in a more comfortable bed in my puff.
reviews.title: Best ever stay in a hotel in the world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on the north east corner hotel of the hotel on the 48th floor and with that factor I think the complete package made this hotel the best I have ever stayed in!
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The staff are brilliant- friendly and informative. The room had a huge flat screen TV (never actually came on as the views were that good!), radio with an attachment for your ipod, king size comfy beds, plenty of nice toiletries, really well cleaned very day, lots of towels, fridge, mini bar, morning newspaper. OK it lacks tea/ coffe making machines but you're in NYC so you're never far from caffeine!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel but a Couple of Negatives

likes.liked: — Very upscale, furnished with quality items
likes.disliked: — Some difficulties with front staff, small double beds

reviews.title: Great Hotel - staff keep to themselves
reviews.text: Very happy with the Hilton. Across the street from subway so you can get anywhere pretty quickly. The staff were good but really kept to themselves, which i like. Not very central but easy to get to on the subway. Cool TV's in the rooms!

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Iffy Location
reviews.text: The Millenium Hotel is everything you would want in a large urbane hotel. The rooms are quite large for NYC and have great views. The service is warm and accommodating, and the prices are excellent. So what seems to be the issue? The location is directly next to Ground Zero and although I applaud the hotel for opening up again shortly after 9/11, the area is very eerie, especially at night.

There simply is not much to do at this downtown location except shop at Century 21 across the street. If you do not mind the subway or taking cabs, it might work for you. As for me, I rather be in the heart of one of New York's more vibrant neighborhoods.
reviews.title: Sleek, stylish, great subway location

reviews.text: Got a corner king city-view room for just under $300 a night, after taxes, which was not too bad considering the good location, convenience, and *amazing* city view from the room. We usually stay in Midtown and enjoyed being away from the congestion of that area. The sleek black tower was easy to find and next to the WTC site. St. Paul's Church right beside the hotel has some compelling exhibits and stories about 9/11 inside and a very old graveyard that is beautiful and parklike. Good shopping is close by too.
reviews.title: Anniversary
Anniversary Getaway
reviews.text: My spouse was duly impressed for his 40th birthday. Furnishings are modern, and wow did he love the flat screen tv on the wall. Nice beds too. (I continue to *hate* the fridge with the hugely marked-up items and no room for your own soda or water.) In NYC, you don't spend too much time in the room, but we had a chance to enjoy a bottle of wine while gazing out over Manhattan at night, lovely! We appreciated the wine glasses and corkscrew in the room, and I liked the Crabtree & Evelyn toiletries.

reviews.title: Average
reviews.text: I just completed a stay at the Millenium Hilton down in the Financial District. I have stayed in plenty of hotels and this one was average in comparison. The air was not working very well and when we called an engineer up there he just said it was because the curtains weren't closed and the sun was coming in. So we closed the curtains and went out for the evening, we came back in at 11p and it was still hot even though the temp was set to 65 degrees. The checkout desk didn't even ask how are stay was or thank us for staying there just handed me the bill and that's it. The concierge and doormen were fantastic! Always holding the door and getting us a taxi as needed. For the most part I think there are far better hotels you can find in manhattan this is not one I would recommend.
if you want luxury and comfort the millenium hilton is the place to go. its excellent staff and luxury comfort makes life worth living.
reviews.title: excellents

reviews.text: Read the other reviews for how great this hotel is. Just look at the views from the room (53rd Floor). The curtains were never closed.......
reviews.title: We will be back. Superb Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Millenium Hilton over Memorial weekend. We chose the hotel based on other Trip Advisor reviews and the fact that it has a pool. We were not disappointed. We had requested a room on a high floor with views of the Brooklyn Bridge and that's exactly what was offered at check in. Robert checked us in and he was extremely pleasant and efficient. My daughter was given a small handbag/purse which she loved and used the entire stay. All the staff were friendly and professional. Rey, the bellman, also went out of his way to be helpful.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: The room was very clean and throughout the stay (5 nights) was always cleaned thoroughly with new sheets half way through the stay and towels offered daily. Closet space was a bit small but there were plenty of drawers. Others have commented on the lack of a coffee maker and the signal on the plasma screen. The internet connection worked well and was $6 a day. The in-room safe can hold a laptop. The views were magnificent and there was no noise from other rooms, the corridors or construction around the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Views, Nice Hotel too!

reviews.text: 3) The location: not in touristy mid-town/Times Square, but convenient subway access/Path train makes up for this. On the weekend, it's almost nice to escape the busier parts of the city by staying downtown. Relatively safe, though some streets appear to be deserted on weekend nights, so best to not walk alone.
reviews.title: Amazing..!!!

reviews.text: I got a wonderful deal on the Millenium Hilton through Priceline. I only had 30 hours in the city and I'm so glad I stayed here. The concierge staff was wonderful and very helpful. The front desk, bell and doormen staff were all very friendly as well. The rooms were clean, stylish and stocked with all the right amenities, including a very cool plasma TV. Stayed on the 22nd floor with a birds-eye view of Ground Zero. The hotel is right across from the PATH station and right near the subway which was very convenient. Its location right off Broadway was also convenient for walking to where I needed to go.
reviews.title: Loved the Millenium!

likes.liked: — Clean and stylish; friendly and helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm heading back again next month and will definitely be staying here
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay

likes.liked: — the new furniture and spacious rooms

reviews.text: again.
reviews.title: Lovin the Millenium Hilton!

likes.liked: — It was clean and the staff were friendly

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights the end of March and beginning of April for vacation in the city I love. I work in the industry and am very familiar with the ins and outs of hotels, and I found nothing lacking here. It's a beautiful hotel in a great downtown location. The rooms are well equipped, nicely furnished and spacious.
reviews.title: Shame on you front desk staff!

reviews.text: The bathrooms are also very nice room enough for two while using the sink vanity area. There are also safes in the room to keep your items in should you need it. But the best are the beds, the new line the Hiltons are using by Serta i swear are the nicest i have ever slept on. Convenient walking to the South Street Seaport, Chinatown, Little Italy, but you don't have the traffic at night like staying in Midtown or the Times Square area. The Subway is pretty accessible as well, depends on the line and the construction that is going on right now like another person said, read the signs they have posted!
reviews.title: An outstanding experience!

likes.liked: — Confort & size of the room/ Stunning view on Brooklyn bridge
likes.disliked: — subway services were not always operating during weekend

reviews.title: An oasis in NY
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for a long weekend sightseeing in New York.

Firstly, it is downtown, near Wall Street and overlooks Ground Zero. It is away from the buzz of midtown which I liked. There is a subway stop directly outside the hotel main entrance which takes about 10 mins to get to Times Square.
reviews.title: Millenium Hilton - Great rooms! Great views! Grumpy Front desk people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a skyscraper so rooms on the upper floors have fantastic views. Rooms are what I'd expect of a Hilton, clean, fairly spacious and modern with a massive flatscreen, not that I watched much TV. I didn't eat at the hotel other than one night I ordered room service which was prompt but expensive. I ate breakfast at the Panini deli just round the corner, try the pancakes!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again as after a busy day uptown it was nice to come back to a quietish area.
reviews.title: Very very nice

likes.liked: — the view and also the fact that it was QUIET
likes.disliked: — it was a bit removed from everything but there is nothing I didn't like

reviews.text: I've been flying to New York for business every few weeks. I'm trying to hit several different hotels in different areas I need to be in. This time I had several meetings in the Financial District so I booked this hotel. I knew the view would be great but maybe a little strange since the World Trade Center is no longer in front of it. You see, this hotel is located right behind where the World Trade Center used to be.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and helpful staff

likes.liked: — Really comfortable, well equipped rooms. Good location.

reviews.title: WONDERFUL
reviews.text: We stayed at the Millienium last year in May for a weekend and loved it. The hotel does have a depressing view on one side (WTC site) but other than that there is nothing wrong with it. Even though outside our window was the site we still had a great view looking up and all the way to the river. The staff downstairs were great and cordial. The room was wonderful. Not large but considering NYC it was nothing to complain about. If you have a lot of bags than you might run into some issues but other than that there is no reason to be unhappy. Room and bathroom were clean, bed and sheets soft and comfy, and the flat screen hanging on the wall was also nice. The breakfast we got one morning with room service was not first rate but still satisfying with a generous stock of maple syrop, jam and honey. I really recommend this hotel to anyone who enjoys a nice place to come back to after a long day out on the town.

My husband had stayed here many times for business so he suggested it for a recent weekend trip with family and it turned out to be a good deal (from Hilton web site, we paid under $200 a night which isn't bad in NYC) and a nice place to stay. Note: if you want to hang out and wave at the TV cameras in Times Square, that is not even within walking distance. Not near Broadway, either. This hotel is in the financial district, right across from where the World Trade Center towers once stood. Convenient to subway.
reviews.title: The secret's out, this is the place to stay in NYC!

reviews.text: Lots of cabs around.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The room was small and modern and very clean but the view was awesome -- we were on a corner so we could look out at Ground Zero and the new building underway plus see out to the water and across to Brooklyn. Battery Park is within walking distance (wonderful views, can go to Ellis Island and Statute of Liberty from here. The tulips were blooming and we people watched the joggers and doggies and such). Also close are SoHo, TriBecca and Chinatown. Century 21 is next door to the hotel and J&R Music World is nearby. Fewer tourists and what a relief to be away from the zoo that is Times Square but the hotel was full when we stayed so don't expect to have the place for yourself on a weekend (bummer!) The Crabtree and Evelyn bath products are nice. Breakfast buffet had 2 kinds of eggs, suasage, bacon, fresh fruit, cereals, granola, French toast, wonderful pastries and bagels and more that I am simply not remembering. It was free due to H's Diamond status but they charge $20 ordinarily. Fear not: there are several Starbucks nearby as well as many other options.
reviews.title: Best hotel in downtown manhattan
This Suite was Sweet
reviews.text: Front desk and housekeeping staffs were courteous and efficient. We'd booked online and everything was smooth -- we needed 2 rooms, one a handicapped accessible and that was not a problem. Though we booked separately, we made a note online and they did put rooms together.

The hotel overlooks the World Trade Center in the Financial District. It is not right in the middle of the touristy sites, but it's so easy to get around via the subway. (The Gray Line bus tour has a stop just on the other side of the block too!) The hotel itself is very nice. Tall and skinny, so it has the feel of a smaller hotel, with about 10 rooms on each floor. The rooms were average size, nicely furnished, and with such an incredible view of the WTC site, World Financial Center buildings, the river, and beyond into New Jersey. We didn't have much interaction with the staff, but they seemed friendly. And when I asked at the front desk for more shampoo, someone came to the room within 15 minutes with a whole bag of extra toiletries. We really enjoyed our stay!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: We usually stay at more independent hotels when we go to New York for two reasons; usually a lot more inexpensive and predictable on the amenities/service (once you've found a good one). This trip was somewhat last minute and we looked at all of our usual locales and came up with nothing. The Millennium Hilton looked appealing because it was basically the same price as less than stellar comparables and it was right by all of the subway lines we needed.
reviews.title: Great Location/Amenities...Just In The Budget

reviews.text: Bottom line...we were blown away by the quality of the rooms, service, and location. It's basically a 4 star hotel in my opinion for NYC.
