Across the street from the WTC site its within blocks of almost all subway lines (W,Q,N,E,C,B,etc.). Would definitely stay there again if we could get the same deal (around $200), but have a feeling that its cheap only because of all of the construction going on in the area.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, Disappointing Guest Service

reviews.text: Overall, the Millennium Hilton is very close to being a very solid hotel. The facilities are excellent, but serious guest service problems keep this hotel from reaching its full potential. It is very unfortunate that such a lovely facility is held back by repeated gaffes on the part of the staff. If they could iron out these wrinkles this property has the potential to really shine. But, as it is, the disappointing treatment by the staff is enough to take this off of hotels that I would return to.
reviews.title: OK, if you get a good price
Very nice hotel
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for three nights at $180/night via Hotwire.com. This was an excellent value compared to similarly priced hotels in Midtown (where we prefer to stay) which were running in the $250+ range during that time.

We stayed here only one night but were impressed immediately upon entering the establishment. The staff was friendly and although we arrived a few hours earlier than check-in time, we were able to go straight to our room on the 24th floor. The view was absolutely breathtakingly beautiful yet sad (WTC) at the same time. The bed was so comfy and the bathroom was spacious and immaculate. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Good but some negative points

likes.liked: — The views and proximity to the financial district

reviews.text: I used tripadvisor reviews to help chose this hotel for our stay in New York and was very pleased with the choice.
reviews.title: reliable, comfortable, classy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked the room through Hotwire so we expected to get a broomcloset next to the ice machine. Surprise, we got a lovely room on the 53rd floor with a spectacular view of the Brooklyn Bridge. We sat at our window and watched all the lights come on at dusk -- it was more than amazing.
reviews.title: awesome room, awesome view

likes.liked: — Everything was modern and sparkling clean

reviews.text: Our room was small but clean and modern. Large plasma TV, comfortable bed, Crabtree and Evelyn shampoo, conditioner, etc., wallsafe, and comfortable easy chair.
reviews.title: Well Worth It!!
Very Nice Overnight
reviews.text: Staff could not have been nicer.
Even on the weekend the area was alive with street vendors and tourists bustling about. Many subway lines within walking distance. Broadway bus (southbound) 1 block away.
reviews.title: wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel through priceline for one night before moving to Affinia Manhattan.....can't say enough good things....comfortable beds, nice thick linens, above all quiet location....nice views of ground zero from the rooms....found it alittle more difficult to get around compared to affinia manhattan but all in all very pleased.....recently renovated due to the attack on the WTC and it shows........ very nice!
reviews.title: Nice and Quiet
Great Location
reviews.text: This was my 3rd trip to NY and my 1st stay at The Millenium Hilton. I went to a congress in Westchester on March, 2 and 3 and my wife joined me after that for a whole week in the city. Wow, we had fun and the hotel was one of the reasons why we're still missing our week at The Big Apple. I had the warmest check in welcome of my life! Rooms, Housekeeping, Room Service, Front Desk, Staff in general, they're all fabulous! Liquis Assets Bar was also great for drinks before dinner. But, most of all, location seems to be the huge secret of the place. There are a few subway lines (some of them express lines) nearby which take you midtown or uptown in a few minutes (Lines 4 & 5 express trains). Anyway, the Financial Distric is very close to great spots like South Seaport, Soho, Lower East Side and even East and Greenwich Village. These are the places to go with their trendy restaurants and bars, nightlife and fun. But if you prefer the traditional touristic spots in Midtown and fancy the Upper East side...well, just take the 4 or 5 subway lines! There's a 4 storey shop just round the corner where you can buy almost everything to wear. Battery Park's also very close and there are some museums, bars and shops if you must stay downtown.

reviews.title: Awesome Stay!
reviews.text: Breakfast's very expensive though, but you can have it at so many places nearby.
My wife and I will surely be back to this hotel next time we come to NY. Definately!
reviews.title: Almost perfect!

likes.liked: — The spotless room with a view
likes.disliked: — The expensive breakfast buffet, which we did not have!

reviews.title: To Much Attitude and Bad Customer Service
reviews.text: Anna and Andre, Lisbon, Portugal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I wanted to stay in a new part of town - we searched travelocity and saw that this hotel was cheaper than the ones in times square. Seemed to have good ratings on tripadvisor, so decided to book.
reviews.title: Great room

reviews.text: W had trouble finding the hotel - our map didn't show the closed streets. We arrived a little after noon. I noticed that the hotel was crazy busy - we had to find someone at valet to leave our car with, they didn't come to us. Walked into the hotel, seemed very disorganized, very busy. I was suprised how busy the hotel was on Easter weekend. Font desk would not let us check in early, so we checked our luggage and went on our way. Got back later that evening, checked in with no problems. Room was outstanding! Very comfy bed, loved the Crabtree bath products! Was very clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Turned my wife away with hotels.com reservation

reviews.text: We walked to Chinatown, which was very close - so much fun! We ate at "Oriental Garden", it was wonderful!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great area.

reviews.text: My husband whisked me away to New York City for my Christmas present, needless to say I was blown away by the city and the hotel. The view from our room was great, the floor to ceiling windows and flat screen TV were nice touches and the bed was possibly the most comfortable either of us have slept in. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the lift was super quick! Would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Loved it!
ok, not great
reviews.text: My family of 6 spent 2 nights (thanksgiving) at this Hilton. The lobby is very small by HIlton standards. Check in was smooth. Got to the room to find that the double beds were smaller than standard size. So we called to the front desk to order roll aways. No problem, $25 per bed per room. Yikes! Our sons room mini fridge was full of old and smelly food. Housekeeping came up quickly to remove. Later that evening I called for more washcloths as there was only 1 in our room. An hour later they were delivered. Plasma screen tvs don't impress me like they seem to impress so many other guests. tv is tv. We go to NYC to see the sights not watch things we can watch at home. Exercise facilities and pool are very nice. Having to pay for internet service is ridiculous! I find it funny that Hampton Inn's don't charge for internet service and yet the more upscale Hilton properties try to grab more money from you for something that should easily be included in your hotel quote.

reviews.title: A fine place to kip!
reviews.text: Location of this Hilton is only a minor inconvenience. Subway is just across the street and taxis are plentiful. Valet parking only at $45 per night. No in and out parking available. Takes about 25 mintues to get your car.
Had desert in the hotel restaurant. Very good and staff was very friendly. Breakfast was suppose to be included but my husband had to go to the front desk to have the charges removed.
reviews.title: ooohhh... that plasma...

reviews.text: Being across the street from the World Trade Center site was humbling and my family spent some time just looking out our windows at the site as well as walking around the area.
reviews.title: Not so far out of the way.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here again and were not disappointed. The rooms are big for NYC and sparkling clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We had a great view of the re-building of One World Trade center and the river. It is all the way downtown and may not be convenient for everybody but it was a perfect location for what we were doing.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay overall - overlooking Ground Zero and with wonderful views, especially if you're higher up (we stayed 40th floor). Good facilities (gym, pool) and helpful concierge, receptionist etc. Only downer was the fact that they don't have WIFI, and you have to plug in via one of those old school wires (my Mac didn't even have the right docking plug). Apparently they're upgrading it by the end of the year, but the receptionists said that this had been chatted about for years and still hadn't happened.
reviews.title: Great location, dark ages internet

reviews.text: If internet access if important to you, maybe choose somewhere else. Booking through hotwire is also good.
reviews.title: My favorite NYC Hotel!

reviews.text: I've stayed here for around 30 nights since May 2010 and this place always leaves me more relaxed than the last stay. The location is excellent and the staff is wonderful. The doorman are very attentive and keep up with the high volume very well. The front desk team has great suggestions and makes you feel taken care of.
reviews.title: Good overall

reviews.text: The rooms are beautiful and not too small for your typical NYC trip. I will say tho after staying in a corner junior suite, I don't think I'd ever not pay the extra for it. They are so comfortable!
reviews.title: Fantastic view and great service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here at the end of March 2011 with my partner. I knew it was close to ground zero but wow! Our room overlooked the now building site. It felt very weird but it was an amazing view of NYC and the Hudson!
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.text: Rooms immaculate, staff helpful. An unforgettable stay!
reviews.title: Leaving me on hold/not responding to my call on bed bugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and thought it was a good place to stay downtown. However, I just stayed there and was bitten by bed bugs--my whole arm--and they put me on hold for the "manager" for over 15 minutes. I emailed and received no reply!
reviews.title: What a view!

reviews.text: I would think that they would treat this with more urgency due to the risk of not dealing with their infestation because it will only get worse.
reviews.title: not worth the money in my opinion

reviews.text: I stayed here in order to visit the rebuilding of the Trade Center. My room was on the 40th floor and overlooked the site. What a view!
reviews.title: Good Downtown Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Millenium Hilton for 3 nights. We thought it was a great place. Staff was very friendly. The rooms were very clean and new. Our bed was exceptionally comfortable. We had a 38th floor view directly down on the World Trade Center site. This was quite sobering, but also gave us the opportunity to appreciate the magnitiude more than looking at it from ground level. As others have said, this is definitely a quieter part of the city. If you are looking for lots of action around you, this is not the part of town to stay in. However, there are several close subway stops and we found that almost any part of town could be reached within a 15 minute subway ride. We definitely would recommend the Millenium Hotel to anyone looking for top-notch accomodations in NYC.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — The comfort, modern amenities and cleanliness of the room

reviews.text: Stayed there last week on business. The room had everything one would expect plus a large flat screen television.
reviews.title: Good Business Hotel
Great view- pleasant stay
reviews.text: I stayed here for Christmas with my fiancee. The view from the 40th floor is beautiful. The bed was really comfy but for the price the room was rather small.- But you are paying for the hotel name and the plasma TV in the room.

reviews.title: A wonderful getaway
reviews.text: My wife and I live only an hour from New York City but we decided to combine a trip to the NY Restaurant Show with a getaway weekend, sort of an early Valentines Day treat. Just being away from our kids and pets for two whole nights would be a treat anywhere but the Millenium Hilton made the weekend a memory for a lifetime.
We left our car in the suburbs and took NJ transit and a PATH train to the hotel. Public transit couldn't be much easier; a walk across the street puts you in the hotel lobby.
reviews.title: Fantastic views - excellent service

reviews.text: We were very early and arranged to leave our bags there before heading to the Javits for our show. The show was ok but we both knew the weekend really wouldn't begin until we were in our room, so around 4 PM we returned. We had booked through the hotel itself, not the Hilton 800 number. The rate was below $200 for a city view King room (facing Ground zero). On check in they tried to put us on the 17th floor. We had requested a high floor for the view. I asked if they could go any higher and we were given a room on the 52nd floor.
reviews.title: Great Stay At The Millenium
Superb Hotel
reviews.text: The view was sobering as others have said but amazing from an emotional, historic, and engineering sense.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located close next to "ground zero" where the World Trade Centres stood. Being diamond members we were upgraded to a suite that overlooked ground zero and the bay area. The view was fantastic, however the sleep quality was poor. It was as if we were stuck in a night club and the lights just wouldnt come off. Its a pretty nice hotel for a fun get away.
reviews.title: View is fabulous

reviews.text: When we got inot our room, we opened the window coverings to see "Ground Zero" below us. There were a lots of feelings relted to what we ere looking at. It was as if someone took a picture.
reviews.title: Emotional View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was excellent. The room wa clean and bright. It was a comfortable place to come back to after a busy day in the city.
reviews.title: Right across the street from Ground Zero

reviews.text: Most of all there was that view!
reviews.title: If you like downtown Manhatten, not a bad place

reviews.text: Hotel is in a great location. Right across the street from Ground Zero and St. Paul Cathedral. 5-10 minute walk to Soho, 10 minute walk to Seaport, 15-20 minute walk to Chinatown and, most importantly, 2 minutes from Red Mango. Our view from the room was amazing: we could see Ground Zero below, as well as overlooking the harbor (?). We heard construction noise would be an issue, but that wasn't the case. My only complaint is the public bathroom in the lobby, which I made the mistake of using. The one unisex bathroom was disgusting, prolly cuz of all the tourists who just walk in to use it. Overall though, it was a nice hotel.
reviews.title: We really enjoyed our week at Millenium Hilton NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This last visit to NYC, July 14 to July 18, marks our 5th stay at the Millenium Hilton, and I feel we must join in the chorus of praises for this outstanding Hilton. The front desk staff, Graphika and Arturo in particular, have always extended themselves, way beyond the call of duties, to help us and other guests feeling welcomed and comfortable. And even though Hilton hotels have always impressed us, I simply must place Rutger Vandenberg, the Front Office manager, in a class by himself. As usual during other stays, there are some pleasant surprises this time: for instances, on two of the days, we found complimentary apples during HH in the lobby. The rest of the staff, from the concierges, bell captain, bell boys and housecleaning staff, are always pleasant, helpful and polite. There is just one minor nuisance during this visit: the FAN button of the AC is always set to automatic and cannot be changed to ON or OFF. But it did not distract us from enjoying this great hotel.
reviews.title: Our 5th stay at this hotel - home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a corner Junior Suite July 3 & 4. We enjoyed the usual great service & well cleaned room. This review has to do with one unfortunate circumstance. Our room had a southern & western exposure. July 4 was a very warm day and after returning after a long hot day of activities we were looking forward to resting and maybe a nap before dinner and the fireworks. Our room was like an oven, the thermostat was already on it's highest position and it showed the room was 82*. It was way too late to even think of changing rooms or have the A/C serviced. I don't know if it was just that room or a problem throughout the hotel with the same SW exposure. If you are staying there this summer in a room with a SW exposure be sure to leave a note to the maid with her tip to keep the heavy drapes drawn.
reviews.title: A Hilton Fan

reviews.text: Great staff. Great views. Great rates. Great location. Will stay here again. The staff went above and beyond and the room was better than perfect. Heard no construction noise inside the hotel and room.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: I was concerned after reading some of the reviews about the noise at the WTC site. We had a lovely room on the 38th floor and heard minimal sounds and thought the birds eye view into the site was unbelievable!!! I could of sat at that window and watched forever!!! The room was well appointed and comfortable. The staff was excellent and gave us great directions, recommendations and always were quick to offer help. Great for runners- close to Brooklyn Bridge and enjoyed a second run at the promenade area next to the River by the World Financial center. Really wonderful location, even with the construction and general madness at the site!!!
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: I've stayed in NY many times at the Ritz Carlton in Battery Park, the Millenium Hilton is no Ritz. I immediately got the impression that the hotel staff dislike their jobs and readily blame guests for their own poor service. Less than average level of service for the $$$.
reviews.title: Great location - poor service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here June 7th-9th and the weekend was amazing. The rooms are great and the staff was excellent. The hotel is located right next to one of the secret gems in NYC, Century 21. That was the only way I could covince my girlfriend at the time to go to NY for the weekend, we are no married since.
reviews.title: Got engaged in New York's Central Park...

reviews.text: While it is located directly across from the WTC site and is historic in that aspect, the jackhammers are still going at 10:30 PM at night and start at 6:30 AM in the morning. If you are a light sleeper, forego the "view" and ask for a room away from the re-construction site. Third floor "restaurant" is less than satisfactory. Took 10 minutes to get cream for my coffee. Wait staff in the morning was lazy and just couldn't be bothered. Food was mediocre at best. The night staff in the hotel restaurant was more accommodating and couldn't be nicer when we arrived from out of town - tired and hungry. They were much more accommodating and pleasant than the breakfast morning staff. Time to have a sit down with the breakfast waiters ! Not the best way to start a busy day of business.
reviews.title: Noisy if you are a light sleeper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed in a lot of NYC hotels, and toured many more in a previous life (career). Our room was so spacious!
reviews.title: great hotel with sad view

reviews.text: The location, however, I just don't know. Obviously, if you have business in the area, or have never really wandered that far south, it's worth it, but taking a cab uptown for every little show or museum is tiresome and expensive. If you are actually doing the tourist thing the location really isn't ideal. Of course, if you haven't really been there, there's a lot to offer nearby; much of it new - the hunger memorial; that new ferry station. The view into the WTC site is really sad.
reviews.title: LOVE IT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is pretty good. Like all the Hilton franchise, you have to pay for every little thing, including internet or any decent tv. We had to ask the front desk for a sewing kit to replace a button. They refused us extra coffee. My husband was kinda cranky about that - he says that there's no benefit to better coffee if you're limited to one cup per person per day. On the other hand, I honestly think our housekeeper was the best I've ever encountered.
reviews.title: Great view, poor service

reviews.text: I booked a room at the Hilton for two nights in late June while I waited for a moving company to deliver furniture to my new apartment in Manhattan. After the moving company had to postpone my move date due to an equipment failure two hours after I checked out of the hotel, I was stuck for the night with nowhere to stay. After getting off the phone with the movers, I headed back to the hotel, hoping they'd have ANYTHING available so I wouldn't have to carry all of my suitcases to another place and expecting to pay a lot more, since it was very last-minute on a holiday weekend and my previous reservation had been made via Priceline at a steep discount from the advertised price. Not only did the desk staff offer me back my original room several hours before check-in (already cleaned up and looking great) after asking whether I had liked it , they booked it for me at a very reasonable price only slightly higher than I'd paid for the first two nights. To make matters worse for my move, I was told by the apartment building management that I couldn't move anything in until the following week, so the Hilton extended my reservation for an additional two nights at the price they quoted me earlier. If I ever need to stay at another hotel in NYC, it'll be this one!
reviews.title: Best customer service and best New York hotel I've experienced!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a note, I've seen some complaints about the construction in the area (post-9/11 WTC rebuilding), but I wasn't bothered by it at all despite being a troubled sleeper. It is a little noisy if you're outdoors in the area during the day, but from my room, I never heard more than a low hum that was almost completely muffled when the A/C was running. And I actually enjoyed the view of the Freedom Tower being built - can't wait to see the final result!
reviews.title: Nice rooms, good business location long way to shoppping and other sights

reviews.text: Stayed here for a few days in June while passing through New York. Its a lovely hotel but I wouldn't stay here again simply because I love walking around central park and Time Square etc but its very far away from all these places and the best shopping. We found it really difficult to get taxis as they all prefer the shorter runs, it cost us a fortune coming and going as all the restaurants we like are up the other end too. We would have stayed in the Waldorf for what we spent on taxis! Its a nice hotel if you wnat to around the business district or ground zero area.
reviews.title: Not great

reviews.text: Checking in for a brief one night stay, had to change rooms twice due to that yucky mildewy bathroom smell that can permeate a small hotel room. Construction noise all night compounded with our neighboring room have a rockin party in the middle of the night, made for an undesirable stay. Better luck next time for us.
reviews.title: A mix of good and average.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good- location, great view of the WTC site and construction, nice sized room with decent decor, big tv and a good layout for the desk. The housekeeper was super friendly and helpful- she double checked when I passed by if my room was cleaned to my satisfaction and if she could get me anything else- great service.
reviews.title: Less than my expectation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautifully decorated, fresh and clean. I love the location--many good restaurants and shopping nearby. The rooms and beds are very comfortable and roomy by NYC standards. We were originally given a room with a view of "ground zero" and the Hudson River in the background. When we found this too depressing we requested another room and were given a room with a view of the Brooklyn Bridge with no problems. We enjoyed the view and our stay very mush. Great staff! Only one complaint was that when we left for breakfast and came back to our room the maid had already stripped our bedding off. It was only 9AM!
reviews.title: Impeccable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from 3 nights at the Millenium Hilton...we could have not wished for a better hotel and location in NYC.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel & location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's right next door to Century 21 and minutes to Soho and Tribeca.
reviews.title: Nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very modern and elegant...the elevators are CRAZY fast which is convenient.
reviews.title: Lovely rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to everyone!!!
reviews.title: Loved it!!!

reviews.text: Stayed at this locale over Memorial Weekend. Very helpful staff. Was a litte concerned about the location, but found it to be ok. Right next to a subway stop, which is great. Room was 1 king bed w/ a 40+inch flat screen, which was a nice touch. Room was well decorated and decent size.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a fantastic short break in New York at stayed at the Millenium Hilton, while it was quite expensive, you definately get your money's worth. We had a junior suite which was immaculate, the maid service was excellent.
reviews.title: Favorite NYC Hotel
Fantastic
reviews.text: I found the staff to be very helpful and polite and nothing appeared to be too much trouble for them. The pool and sauna were lovely, although the water was very cold! The restaurant was lovely, although I struggled to find something I wanted on the menu, ended up with a salad which was very nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was excellent, the subway was right nearby and taxis from Times Square (for when we were feeling lazy in the evening) were reasonably cheap.
reviews.title: Beautiful Room and View

reviews.text: This is without a doubt the best Hilton I've stayed at within the US. Everything about this hotel was excellent. The junior suite was well equiped and the dining facilities were second to none in nyc. The only downside to the hotel is the location on the weekend. Downtown nyc isn't exactly 'THE' place to be. But I can handle the taxi ride for other advantages of this hotel!!!!
reviews.title: Best Hilton

reviews.text: On a four days week-end in NYC, we had decided to stay 2 nights uptown at the Benjamin and 2 nights downtown at the Millenium, based on TripAdvisor's ranking system.
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.text: As much as we were disappointed with the first one, we loved staying at the Millenium: low prices for Manhattan, spectacular view, stylish and modern room. The staff was very helpful: the concierge gave us good advice on bikes' rental and transportation back to the airport and they allowed us to check out at 1:30pm at no extra cost.
reviews.title: Best Hilton Ever!

reviews.text: A hotel to recommend and go back to!
reviews.title: Some good suggestions...

reviews.text: I have listed all the major points below
reviews.title: Highly Recommended Hotel

reviews.text: This is a solid hotel for business travelers.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for Business Travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was quick and efficient; however I did check in on a Sunday afternoon, a relatively quiet time.
reviews.title: Decent hotel * Great location * Spectacular views

reviews.text: The rooms are smaller, plenty of room for one person but I would not bring my wife here for a vacation trip as it would be too busy for two people.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The work desk and internet hookup are well laid out, but you will need to pay for internet if you are not a Hilton Honors member, although at $12 for 24 hours it is not an outrageous charge.
reviews.title: Not what I was expecting!

reviews.text: The bar in the lobby is small but well stocked.
reviews.title: Nice except the breakfast...

reviews.text: This was our first trip to this hotel in some time. We used to stay here in the late 90s and found it quite enjoyable. Still very good. Like the area. The jr suites are quite roomy. We returned b/c our son wanted a pool. I can say that it was worth it for the rooms, as well as the pool. I see myself returning again soon.
reviews.title: Good hotel well maintained
Perfect for Work
reviews.text: All of lower manhattan is easily accessible. Hotel is large but quiet, excellent and fast service. Rooms are typical for NY. Ideal for business travel, although room service is needlessly expensive. Very highly recommended, espcially if you need to be downtown for work.

I stayed here for one night on a recent business trip. I loved how convenient it was to get to mid town in a hurry. It was maybe 15 minutes to get to grand central station (Fulton Street Stop, 5 train) and no changing trains. The next day, to get to MOMA (highly recommended) it was a straight shot on another line, Courtland Station, R train. Both stops were within a hundred feet of the Hilton and got me to my destination quickly and efficiently.
reviews.title: Great location near several subway stops

reviews.text: Yes, there is construction right across the street, but I never heard it during the night and had a wonderful night of sleep. The service was also excellent, each employee i talked to was very nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Great View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great NYC view from the 52nd floor overlooking the 9/11 Memorial Park and the Hudson River. Room was clean, quiet and well appointed. Bed was comfortable with quality linens.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: I thought this was a decent property in that it is quite new and the rooms were pretty good for a Hilton. However I was disappointed that there was no concierge lounge and I was not offered any breakfast or drink vouchers as is customary for Diamond VIP benefits. Also the WFC neighborhood pretty much shuts down after dark with not many food options. It is nearby the subway both the ACE and 4,6 lines. I will probably continue to look for a better hotel to stay in for frequent NYC business travel.
reviews.title: Decent property, boring location and no Diamond benefits

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For $135 on Priceline, we had an outstanding stay over a Saturday night. No noise, either internal or external, in our 18th floor room (perhaps because there is no construction on Saturday night or Sunday morning), one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've had in years, and a clean and functional bathroom added up to a perfect stay for us.
reviews.title: Outstanding value
An otherwise nice experience marred by poor service
reviews.text: Great hotel, good location, well appointed rooms BUT, service is a problem. When we arrived at 4:00 PM there were dirty dishes from breakfast on the floor outside our door (and were still there at 7:00 PM when we went out for dinner). Then at 10:00 PM I realized that I had forgotten a prescription medicine and called the front desk to find a pharmacy and were told that there were none in Manhattan that were open this late and offered me a hotel doctor for $300. ((I'm not sure how that was supposed to help if there was no pharmacy and I already had a prescription). I went on the Internet (for $14.95) and found one a short taxi ride away and all was solved.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here over thanksgiving 2008 and with the price reduction because of the WTC rebuild its perfect. An super quality hotel following its own facelift with great room size and cleanliness.
reviews.title: Superb quality, great price, nice and modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We upgraded to a high floor corner room, and although you can still slightly hear some of the construction, after a day out in NYC you should be tired enough to sleep right through. The views from high up the hotel are excellent, we could see the Statue of Liberty, over to Jersey and the Brooklyn Bridge.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: It was a very good stay, the room was large, clean and comfortable, the staff did everything to make our stay pleasant.
reviews.title: very good hotel
Very good hotel, especially if you get a good rate
reviews.text: Breakfast was good, and the restaurant as well.

reviews.title: 4th july at milennium
reviews.text: We did get an interesting price for our family of four, but we booked that much in advance.

I booked this hotel for a long weekend in July, primarily because of the many good reviews on tripadvisor.com, and I wasn't disappointed. This is mainly a business hotel, because of its location in lower Manhattan, and it costs over $300 a night during the week. You can however get some very good weekend rates: I ended up paying $189 per night plus taxes, which is very good value for a 4 star hotel in Manhattan.
reviews.title: Dosen't Get much better for the price
Stay over weekend at the Millenium
reviews.text: The room was very clean and well decorated in a modern style. The bed was very comfortable. The plasma TV was a nice touch.

aka: Millenium Hilton Hotel New York City
